title: [Large-Scale] Virtual Laboratory-Based Project Learning Design for Engineering Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Engineering Principles and Experimental Methods
context.additional_context: Focus on cultivating real-life problem-solving skills through team-based projects in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments

learning_goals: Learners perform three engineering projects (e.g., circuit design, structural analysis) in both virtual and physical labs, then analyze participation differences between environments at an 80% confidence level using a participation survey (5-point Likert scale) and observation checklist (frequency, number of questions, collaboration time).
They derive at least three learner motivation factors when designing virtual lab-based projects.

Learners develop ≥3 measurement indicators (e.g., number of idea proposals, completeness of material preparation, collaborative attitude) to evaluate individual contributions in a 4-member team project, create an assessment checklist applying these indicators, and obtain agreement from ≥80% of team members.
Over 80% of learners achieve the ability to apply engineering theory knowledge to virtual lab projects.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
